name: Sicán National Museum
address: Av. Batán Grande cuadra 9 s/n, Carretera Pítipo, Ferreñafe, Lambayeque, Peru
description: Archaeological museum showcasing the Sican culture: funerary masks, metalwork, ceramics and archaeological displays.

name: Bosque de Pómac Historic Sanctuary
address: Pitipo District, Ferreñafe Province, Lambayeque, Peru
description: Protected dry-forest area with dozens of Sican pyramids (huacas), wildlife viewing and guided cultural walks.

name: Huaca El Loro (in Bosque de Pómac)
address: Inside Bosque de Pómac Historic Sanctuary, Ferreñafe, Lambayeque, Peru
description: One of the main archaeological pyramid complexes inside Pómac — excellent for photography and cultural exploration.

name: Laquipampa Wildlife Refuge
address: Incahuasi District, Ferreñafe Province, Lambayeque, Peru
description: Dry-forest refuge protecting species such as the white-winged guan; trails, waterfalls and birdwatching opportunities.

name: Túcume (Valley of the Pyramids)
address: Túcume District, Lambayeque Region (near Ferreñafe / Chiclayo)
description: Large archaeological complex of many adobe pyramids from Sican/Chimú/Inca cultures — popular archaeological visit nearby.

name: Plaza de Armas of Ferreñafe
description: Central square with colonial architecture, gardens and local life — free to visit and great for a short walk.

name: Church of Saint Lucia (Iglesia Santa Lucía)
description: Local colonial-era church with characteristic ornamentation — open for visits and photography (donation-based).

name: Ferreñafe Market (Mercado)
address: Central area / main streets of Ferreñafe (e.g., Av. Tacna area)
description: Traditional local market where you can taste regional food, buy produce and experience local culture.
